section_id: ## 9.2. The Cloning Operator as a Markov Kernel

hints.label: def-cloning-operator-formal
hints.title: The Cloning Operator $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$
hints.content:
5809: :label: def-cloning-operator-formal
5810: 
5811: The **cloning operator** $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ is a Markov transition kernel on the swarm state space $\Sigma_N$. For any input swarm configuration $S \in \Sigma_N$, it produces a probability measure $\Psi_{\text{clone}}(S, \cdot)$ on $\Sigma_N$.
5812: 
5813: **Domain and Range:**
5814: - **Input:** A swarm configuration $S = ((x_1, v_1, s_1), \ldots, (x_N, v_N, s_N)) \in \Sigma_N$ with at least one alive walker ($|\mathcal{A}(S)| \geq 1$).
5815: - **Output:** A probability measure over swarm configurations $S' \in \Sigma_N$ where all walkers have status $s'_i = 1$ (the intermediate, all-alive configuration).
5816: 
5817: **Stochastic Structure:**
5818: 
5819: The operator is defined by a composition of deterministic and stochastic sub-operators:
5820: 
5821: $$
5822: \Psi_{\text{clone}} = \Psi_{\text{update}} \circ \Psi_{\text{decision}} \circ \Psi_{\text{fitness}} \circ \Psi_{\text{measure}}
5823: $$
5824: 
5825: where each sub-operator is defined in the subsequent sections.
5826: 
5827: **Key Property - All-Alive Output:**
5828: 
5829: By construction, the output configuration $S' \sim \Psi_{\text{clone}}(S, \cdot)$ satisfies:
5830: 
5831: $$
5832: s'_i = 1 \quad \text{for all } i \in \{1, \ldots, N\}
5833: $$
